FuncDef:
The domain identifier command configures a BGP-LS domain ID.
The undo domain identifier command deletes a BGP-LS domain ID.
By default, a BGP router ID is used as the BGP-LS domain ID.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a BGP-LS domain ID.
The value is in the IPv4 address format.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A BGP-LS domain ID indicates that BGP-LS is enabled on a device. To configure a BGP-LS domain ID, run the domain identifier command. By default, a BGP router ID is used as the BGP-LS domain ID.
One BGP-LS domain ID can be configured for multiple devices so that the controller calculates routes based on the combined topology information reported by the devices.
